author: vladimirp
title: Cardano Emerging Threat Alarm

assessments.note:
The creation of proposals that seek to assess and monitor blockchain risks is fundamental to Cardano's sustainability and shows alignment with Cardano's future.

We know that IOG will submit a proposal to expand the contractual link in Cardano's development for a few more years, but I think it is important that leaders within the community emerge and start taking steps towards decentralization and this challenge is an opportunity for them to emerge. proposals that seek to create an independent risk monitoring/ checks and balances model.

it is of utmost importance that a system like this is implemented to ensure the security of assets, identity and integral system lively interacting with a global ecosystem on a hourly basis. The challenge is important to the community but also the institutions, markets and individuals who are part of this ecosystem.

It is paramount that security is implemented early in any system for a number of reasons. The earlier it is implemented, the sooner the system is protected.
With early implementation, it can also be modified and improved earlier along the way, adding value to system robustness.
I quite like this idea, i believe Cardano is safe by design, but in the complex world of blockchain it's hard (impossible) to predict all major threats.

I strongly support this Challenge Setting. As a multi-billion dollar worth system, we do need a proper risk assessment and risk management setup - just like any other careful 'traditional economy company' has this in place nowadays. This can cover technical aspects, CyberSecurity, as well as economic and social vulnerabilities. The proposed USD 50.000 look reasonable to me for getting this started. This could emerge to become a dedicated branch of our emerging governance system (just as e.g. marketing could  be handled in a dedicated branch or expert working group).

I don't see any technical difficulties that compromise the viability of the challenge, but I believe that the nature of the challenge involves more conceptual proposals / research and this restricts the workforce that could contribute to the creation of proposals.

Some form of this may already be put in place to ensure the safety of the system technologically but perhaps not in a way that it can interact with day to day influences of the world directly or indirectly. Like the effect of a war to the system dynamics or the unlikely event of an emp source that could drop down the key elements holding the network going, how do we protect from an individual point of view to the system at large.

This proposal just needs to find some implementers to make it top notch. It's very feasible because who doesn't want security for the system?

The proposition for an option to take collective affirmative action to fend off a threat fits in Voltaire ideology and could therefore be easily adopted by the community.
The very fact that this is being proposed as a challenge by a community member signal that the community is capable of addressing this challenge

I think that throughout the community (including IOG, Foundation, Emurgo and probably external expert partners) we can create a highly competent and community-governed body for this purpose. This would fit nicely to the carefulness that Cardano has demonstrated so far - an important prerequisite for onboarding large companies, governmental partners and major investors. An important ingredient for earning TRUST.

I think that the identification of risks would already be an important element in itself, but without a context of time for the identification of these risks, the definition of success becomes unclear. I recommend the inclusion of a time window so that these risks are evaluated and that this can become some informative material that helps to educate the community about the risks encountered and actions to mitigate or remedy them.

The key metrics have been well thought out and should provide a lot of information to assess the performance / success of the challenge.
The proposal has vast amount of resources, sound strategies and roadmap laid out that promotes a grasp of the key indicators needed to launch the project sucessfully.

Challenges and risks have been clearly defined and effort has been made to describe the problem and solution clearly.
The requested funds is very reasonable.

It will need a roadmap to track development once it has a team.
the proposer describes the main metric: "Did we manage to create a simple mechanism for identifying novel, emerging systemic threats to the Cardano ecosystem?"
Regarding metrics there is not yet much available, but this is quite clear. We need to invest more thought. Super important field of activities.

importance: Cardano complexity increases with decentralization, native tokens, multi-asset support, smart contracts and new users. Threats will emerge.
success: Stable evolution. Cardano successfully onboards new users, developers, DApps, tokens, SPOs, oracles, companies. Threats are identified
